name: market for maize silage | maize silage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21076/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'maize silage', in the geography of Brazil.

With the maize silage at the field gate.

With maize silage delivered to consumers, i.e., as animal feed.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0119:Growing of other non-perennial crops

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Almost all maize silage in Brazil is produced in the same farm it is consumed as animal feed, so transport can be considered irrelevant (less than 10 km for each 10 ton load, or less than 0,01 tkm/kg).
